title: How this disease changes the shape of your cells - Amber M. Yates

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of sickle-cell disease?

options.label: C
options.text: A genetic mutation that alters the structure of hemoglobin proteins

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of the mutated hemoglobin proteins in sickle-cell disease?

options.label: A
options.text: They float independently inside the cell's pliable, doughnut-like shape

options.label: B
options.text: They lock together into rigid rows, causing the cell to deform into a long, pointed sickle

options.label: C
options.text: They increase the flexibility of the red blood cells

multiple-choice.question: What is the original purpose of the mutation that causes sickle-cell disease?

options.label: A
options.text: A beneficial adaptation to protect against malaria

options.label: B
options.text: A harmful adaptation that increases the risk of malaria

options.label: C
options.text: A neutral adaptation that has no effect on the risk of malaria

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of inheriting the mutation from both parents?

options.label: A
options.text: It results in a mild form of sickle-cell disease

options.label: B
options.text: It results in a severe form of sickle-cell disease

options.label: C
options.text: It results in sickle-cell anemia, a condition where patients live with a constantly depleted supply of red blood cells

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary goal of treatment for sickle cell?

options.label: B
options.text: To manage the symptoms of the disease

options.label: C
options.text: To increase the lifespan of patients with the disease

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential new treatment for sickle cell?

options.label: C
options.text: Gene editing to enable stem cells to produce normal hemoglobin

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between sickle-cell disease and malaria?

options.label: A
options.text: Sickle-cell disease increases the risk of malaria

options.label: B
options.text: Malaria increases the risk of sickle-cell disease

options.label: C
options.text: Sickle-cell disease and malaria are unrelated

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of sickle cells on blood vessels?

options.label: A
options.text: They increase the flexibility of blood vessels

options.label: B
options.text: They decrease the stickiness of blood vessels

options.label: C
options.text: They snag and pile up in blood vessels, blocking the flow of oxygen to various tissues

multiple-choice.question: What is the lifespan of a healthy red blood cell?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the flexibility of red blood cells

options.label: B
options.text: To decrease the stickiness of red blood cells

options.label: C
options.text: To carry oxygen molecules from the lungs to the tissues in the body

title: How to biohack your cells to fight cancer - Greg Foot

title: How to spot a pyramid scheme - Stacie Bosley

multiple-choice.question: What was the main requirement for members to start earning money in Vemma Nutrition's business model?

options.text: Purchase a $500-600 kit of liquid nutrition products

options.label: B
options.text: Recruit two more members to do the same

multiple-choice.question: What type of fraud is Vemma Nutrition accused of operating?
What happens to the majority of participants in a pyramid scheme?

options.label: A
options.text: They earn more than they paid in

options.label: B
options.text: They earn less than they paid in

options.label: D
options.text: They lose all the money they paid in

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between a pyramid scheme and a legitimate multi-level marketing company?

options.label: A
options.text: A pyramid scheme requires members to pay for the opportunity to sell a product or service

options.label: B
options.text: A pyramid scheme primarily compensates members for recruitment of new sellers

options.label: C
options.text: A pyramid scheme uses a product or service to hide the pay-and-recruit structure

multiple-choice.question: What is a red flag that indicates a pyramid scheme?

options.label: B
options.text: Promises of large amounts of income

options.label: C
options.text: Requirements for members to pay for the opportunity to sell a product or service

multiple-choice.question: What is the typical behavior of victims of a pyramid scheme?

options.label: B
options.text: They blame themselves for not being tenacious enough

options.label: C
options.text: They keep trying to invest in multiple schemes

multiple-choice.question: What is the recommended action to take if you suspect a pyramid scheme?

options.label: C
options.text: Send the information to three people you know

multiple-choice.question: What is the typical structure of a pyramid scheme?

options.label: A
options.text: A founder who solicits an initial group of people to buy in and promote the scheme

options.label: B
options.text: A group of people who recruit others to buy in and promote the scheme

options.label: C
options.text: A product or service that is used to hide the pay-and-recruit structure

multiple-choice.question: What is the typical behavior of a pyramid scheme as it grows?

options.label: A
options.text: It becomes easier for new recruits to make money

options.label: B
options.text: It becomes increasingly difficult for new recruits to make money

options.label: D
options.text: It becomes harder for earlier joiners to make money

multiple-choice.question: What is the typical outcome for the most recent recruits in a pyramid scheme?

options.label: A
options.text: They earn more than they paid in

options.label: C
options.text: They earn less than they paid in

options.label: D
options.text: They lose all the money they paid in

title: What “Machiavellian” really means - Pazit Cahlon and Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea of Machiavelli's "The Prince"?

options.label: B
options.text: A scathing description of how princely rule operates

options.label: C
options.text: A defense of the elected republican government of Florence

options.label: D
options.text: A warning to free citizens of the ways in which they can be subjugated by aspiring rulers

multiple-choice.question: Who wrote "The Prince"?
What was Machiavelli's role in the government of Florence?

options.label: A
options.text: He was a member of the Medici family

options.label: B
options.text: He was a diplomat for 14 years, defending the elected republican government

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of Machiavelli's work on political philosophy?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to the development of preconceived ideals

options.label: B
options.text: It laid the foundations for thinkers like Hobbes to study human affairs based on concrete realities

options.label: C
options.text: It led to the decline of the republican government of Florence

options.label: D
options.text: It had no impact on political philosophy

multiple-choice.question: What was Machiavelli's goal in writing "The Prince"?

options.label: A
options.text: To advise rulers on how to acquire and maintain power

options.label: B
options.text: To shatter popular delusions about what power really entails

options.label: C
options.text: To defend the elected republican government of Florence

options.label: D
options.text: To warn free citizens of the ways in which they can be subjugated by aspiring rulers

multiple-choice.question: Who interpreted "The Prince" as a warning to free citizens of the ways in which they can be subjugated by aspiring rulers?
What was the result of the Medici family seizing power in Florence?

options.label: A
options.text: Machiavelli was appointed as a member of the Medici family

options.label: C
options.text: The republican government of Florence was strengthened

options.label: D
options.text: The city-states of Italy were united under the rule of the Medici family

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of Machiavelli's work on the concept of "Machiavellian"?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to the development of preconceived ideals

options.label: B
options.text: It led to the decline of the republican government of Florence

options.label: C
options.text: It made the term "Machiavellian" synonymous with manipulative villainy

options.label: D
options.text: It had no impact on the concept of "Machiavellian"

multiple-choice.question: What was Machiavelli's hope for the readers of "The Prince"?

options.label: A
options.text: That they would learn the way to Hell in order to flee from it

options.label: B
options.text: That they would become tyrannical rulers

options.label: C
options.text: That they would defend the elected republican government of Florence

options.label: D
options.text: That they would develop preconceived ideals

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of Machiavelli's brutal and shocking honesty in writing "The Prince"?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to the decline of the republican government of Florence

options.label: B
options.text: It made the term "Machiavellian" synonymous with manipulative villainy

options.label: C
options.text: It shatter popular delusions about what power really entails

options.label: D
options.text: It had no impact on the concept of "Machiavellian"
